page.title: 10Housing
page.content: Carlton has grown considerably since the first World War when it was just a few scattered cottages.People moved to Carlton mainly because of jobs at the power stations of Drax,Ferrybridge and Eggborough.Before the power stations were built Carlton was just a small farming village,with most of the land owned by the ancestors of the Duke of Norfolk. Today there are only a few of the old houses left. Some have been pulled down to build new houses for people that move here to work. There are a lot of new bungalows,detached houses and semi-detached houses. A permanent site for twelve gypsy families has been built on the edge of the village providing hard standings and other modern facilities.Built 1984 it has encouraged them to integrate.
